main.name: Samuel Sausville
main.description: Current Computer Science & Business Student at Lehigh University. Passionate about software product design
main.bio: Love learning about new products that are being offered. Non-fiction reading enthusiast around startups, business and decision making (Check out SocSem below). Avid Seahawks fan, GO HAWKS! If you are looking to get to know me, take me to a Mexican Restaurant or Taco Bell and I am all yours!
main.contactmessage: Please contact me about potential opportunities, or if you just want to chat!

resume.skillmessage: Skilled in Product Management, Full-Stack Development, Database Systems, Mobile Development and Web Development

education.description: Relevant Coursework - Database Systems Algorithms & Applications, Software Engineering, Design & Analysis of Algorithms, Systems Programming in C/C++, Discrete Structures & Algorithms, Programming & Data Structures, Computer Applications in Business, Programming Languages, Financial Accounting

work.title: Product Manager Intern
work.description: Supported the device experience team of 7 members in product design, planning, development, testing and management. Presented 5G market research analyzing current & future 5G adoption, and proposing 20 opportunities for growth. Identified pain points in the design and implementation of a product, mapping 25 customer experiences in MS Visio. Worked in an Agile - Scrum environment, attending 5 weekly stand ups with 2 different teams related to device experience.

work.title: Co-Founder/Full-Stack Software Engineer
work.description: Developed the iOS/Android application, actuating technical feasibility of the UI/UX using the Flutter framework in Dart. Enabled a phone verification route to verify a userâ€™s phone number utilizing Node.js and the Twilio Verify API. Implemented Google Maps and Places API to automatically detect 20 restaurants in near proximity to the user

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
